ygData.msgSnippet: Cantera 1.4 has been released. What s new: 1. Simplified unix build procedure. Cantera should build out of the box on linux, cygwin, Mac OS X, and Solaris.

Cantera 1.4 has been released.

What's new:

1. Simplified unix build procedure. Cantera should build 'out of the 
box' on linux, cygwin, Mac OS X, and Solaris. If you have Python and/or 
MATLAB installed, the appropriate interface will be built and installed 
automatically. You can choose the installation directory.

2. As of this release, Cantera is now hosted by SourceForge at 
http://sourceforge.net/projects/cantera. You can access the current 
version of the source through the read-only CVS server, or download the 
latest release as a tar.gz archive.

3. Fortran 77 support.  A complete example is included of using Cantera 
from Fortran 77. See file 'f77.doc' in the 'cantera documentation' 
package at the SourceForge site.

A Windows version will be released shortly.

Please report bugs, comments, suggestions, etc. either here or 
(preferably) through the SourceForge Cantera site.
